title: Sample and Data Relationship Format for Proteomics (SDRF-Proteomics)
content:
// suppress inspection "GrazieInspection" for whole file
Sample and Data Relationship Format for Proteomics (SDRF-Proteomics)

//only works on some backends, not HTML

//use style like Section 1 when referencing within the document.

//GitHub specific settings

Status of this document

This document provides information to the proteomics community about a proposed standard for sample metadata annotations in public repositories called Sample and Data Relationship File (SDRF)-Proteomics format. Distribution is unlimited.

Version v1.1.0 - 2025-01

Abstract

The Human Proteome Organisation (HUPO) Proteomics Standards Initiative (PSI) defines community standards for data representation in proteomics to facilitate data comparison, exchange, and verification. This document presents a specification for the Sample and Data Relationship Format (SDRF-Proteomics).

Further detailed information, including any updates to this document, implementations, and examples is available at SDRF GitHub Repository. The official PSI web page for the document is the following: 

Motivation

Many resources have emerged that provide raw or integrated proteomics data in the public domain. If these are valuable individually, their integration through re-analysis represents a huge asset for the community .

Unfortunately, proteomics experimental design and sample related information are often missing in public repositories or stored in very diverse ways and formats. For example:

- The CPTAC Consortium provides for every dataset a set of Excel files with the information on each sample including tumor size, origin, but also how every sample is related to a specific raw file (e.g. instrument configuration parameters).

- As a resource routinely re-analysing public datasets, ProteomicsDB, captures for each sample in the database a minimum number of properties to describe the sample and the related experimental protocol such as tissue, digestion method and instrument.

Such heterogeneity often preven
keywords: CS file your PS SDRF EXPRESS MS:1000484 label PRIDE:0000831 MUST ... INFRINGE PATO QY OF AND instrument characteristics LI REQUIRES PRIDE:0000590 EW PRIDE MIAPE PARTICULAR SWATH HCD LIMITED OR STANDARDS BUT ANY JA IS FAIR URI NCIT:C25714 HEREIN WARRANTY data file WARRANTIES README TAB RECOMMENDED cleavage agent details TIP NCI sex MAGE PATCH ancestry category PEPTIDESEQ ZFA PROTEOMICS EFO HLA organism spiked compound HANCESTRO proteomics data acquisition method SILAC SAMEA OPTIONAL SHALL VCF PRIDE:0000834 PRM PSI RAW FOR INITIATIVE NOT TA RFC TO SHOULD PRIDE:0000833 ISA FDR LC THAT EBI ALL PMCID NCIT II III age CELL individual PATO:0000461 MONDO AS CN EM COLUMN PRIDE:0000832 INCLUDING RECOMMEND PP DISCLAIMS UBERON HUPO BTO NCBI THE MS:1001251 biological replicate PRIDE:0000659 USE MHC MAY biosample accession number sample COULD NCIT:C25683 MOD exclamation MS BRENDA XML TMT MAJOR CF NT BMC cell type ENVO SRM PURPOSE ID NOTE IMPLIED VK WILL organism part RIGHTS IMPORTANT CT REQUIRED HTML MIAME source name DDA SAMN CL PTM pooled sample BE AC URL HF PO YAML IDF DJ MC CV INFORMATION MINOR PMID not disease SP SN MERCHANTABILITY FITNESS CPTAC developmental stage CLO technical replicate fraction identifier ROW MT mass DIA

INFRINGE PATO QY OF AND instrument LI REQUIRES PRIDE:0000590 EW PRIDE MIAPE PARTICULAR SWATH HCD LIMITED OR STANDARDS BUT ANY JA IS FAIR URI NCIT:C25714 HEREIN WARRANTY data file WARRANTIES README TAB RECOMMENDED cleavage agent details NCI MAGE PATCH PEPTIDESEQ ZFA PROTEOMICS EFO HLA organism spiked compound HANCESTRO proteomics data acquisition method SILAC SAMEA OPTIONAL SHALL VCF PRIDE:0000834 PRM PSI RAW FOR INITIATIVE NOT TA RFC TO SHOULD PRIDE:0000833 ISA FDR LC THAT EBI ALL PMCID NCIT II III age CELL individual PATO:0000461 MONDO AS CN EM COLUMN PRIDE:0000832 INCLUDING RECOMMEND PP DISCLAIMS UBERON HUPO BTO NCBI THE MS:1001251 biological replicate PRIDE:0000659 USE MHC MAY biosample accession number COULD NCIT:C25683 MOD MS BRENDA TMT MAJOR CF NT BMC cell type ENVO SRM PURPOSE IMPLIED VK WILL organism part RIGHTS CT REQUIRED HTML MIAME DDA SAMN CL PTM pooled sample BE AC URL HF PO YAML IDF DJ MC CV INFORMATION MINOR PMID disease SP SN MERCHANTABILITY FITNESS CPTAC CLO technical replicate fraction identifier ROW MT mass DIA

title: Sample Metadata Guidelines
content:
Sample Metadata Guidelines

Introduction

This document provides guidelines for annotating general sample metadata in SDRF-Proteomics format. These guidelines apply to samples from any organism (human, animal, plant).

For human-specific metadata (disease staging, comorbidities, treatment history), see Human Sample Metadata Guidelines.

Version 1.0.0 - 2025-01

Organism

Column: characteristics[organism]

Ontology: NCBI Taxonomy (NCBITaxon)

Use the scientific name in lowercase. The validator will map to the correct ontology term.

Value |NCBITaxon ID |Description

homo sapiens |NCBITaxon:9606 |Human
mus musculus |NCBITaxon:10090 |Mouse

Organism Part / Tissue

Column: characteristics[organism part]

Ontology: UBERON for mammals/vertebrates, Plant Ontology (PO) for plants, FlyBase Anatomy (FBbt) for Drosophila.

Use lowercase for all values. For cell line samples, use not applicable or specify the tissue of origin (e.g., cervix for HeLa).

Value |UBERON ID |Description

blood |UBERON:0000178 |Whole blood
liver |UBERON:0002107 |Liver tissue

Age

Column: characteristics[age]

Format: {Number}{Unit} where Unit is: Y (Years), M (Months), W (Weeks), D (Days).

For age ranges use: {LowerBound}{Unit}-{UpperBound}{Unit} (e.g., 40Y-50Y).

Use not available when age is unknown, not applicable for immortalized cell lines.

Age Description |SDRF Value

40 years old |40Y
8 weeks old |8W

Developmental Stage

Column: characteristics[developmental stage]

Ontology: UBERON, EFO

Value |Description

adult |Sexually mature organism
embryonic |Pre-birth/pre-hatching

For model organisms, use specific stages when applicable: embryonic day 14 (mouse E14), 24 hpf (zebrafish 24 hours post fertilization).

Disease

Column: characteristics[disease]

Ontology: MONDO Disease Ontology (preferred), EFO, Human Disease Ontology (DOID)

Healthy Samples: normal vs healthy vs control

For samples without disease, the terminology matters for standardization:

normal (PATO:0000461) - Recommended

- S
keywords: organism part PATO:0000461 MONDO SDRF DOID CL EFO PTM MONDO:0005148 organism UBERON MUST NCBI PO CL:0000066 PATO MONDO:0004989 CL:0000815 MONDO:0004975 xenograft MAY disease APP PDX UBERON:0000178 synthetic peptide exclamation CL:0000084 enrichment process developmental stage PATO:0001421 cell type CL:0000624 ID NOTE depletion UBERON:0002107 age

adult |Sexually mature organism

normal (PATO:0000461) - Recommended

- S
keywords: organism part PATO:0000461 MONDO SDRF DOID CL EFO PTM MONDO:0005148 organism UBERON MUST NCBI PO CL:0000066 PATO MONDO:0004989 CL:0000815 MONDO:0004975 xenograft MAY disease APP PDX UBERON:0000178 synthetic peptide CL:0000084 enrichment process developmental stage PATO:0001421 cell type CL:0000624 ID depletion UBERON:0002107 age

title: Human Sample Metadata Guidelines
content:
Human Sample Metadata Guidelines

Introduction

This document provides guidelines for annotating human-specific metadata in SDRF-Proteomics format. These guidelines apply to clinical studies and healthy human samples.

For general sample metadata (organism, age, sex, basic disease), see Sample Metadata Guidelines.

Version 1.0.0 - 2025-01

Disease Stage

Column: characteristics[disease stage]

Ontology: NCI Thesaurus (NCIT)

Value |NCIT ID |Description

stage I |NCIT:C27966 |Early localized disease
stage IV |NCIT:C27971 |Distant metastasis

Use not available when stage is unknown, not applicable for non-cancer samples.

TNM Staging

Column: characteristics[TNM staging]

Ontology: NCI Thesaurus (NCIT)

Format: T{0-4}N{0-3}M{0-1} where T = tumor size/extent, N = lymph node involvement, M = distant metastasis. Prefix p indicates pathological staging.

Value |Description

T1N0M0 |Small tumor, no nodes, no metastasis
pT2pN1M0 |Pathological staging after surgery

Tumor Grade

Column: characteristics[tumor grade]

Ontology: NCI Thesaurus (NCIT)

Value |NCIT ID |Description

grade 1 |NCIT:C28076 |Well differentiated
grade 3 |NCIT:C28078 |Poorly differentiated

Cancer-Specific Classifications

Breast cancer subtype (characteristics[breast cancer subtype]):

Value |NCIT ID |Description

luminal A |NCIT:C53554 |ER+/PR+, HER2-, low Ki67
triple-negative |NCIT:C71732 |ER-/PR-/HER2-

Other classifications: characteristics[Dukes stage] for colorectal cancer, characteristics[Ann Arbor stage] for lymphoma.

Pre-existing Condition

Column: characteristics[pre-existing condition]

Ontology: MONDO Disease Ontology

For multiple conditions, use multiple columns (preferred) or semicolon-separated values.

Condition |SDRF Value |MONDO ID

High blood pressure |hypertension |MONDO:0005044
Diabetes |type 2 diabetes mellitus |MONDO:0005148

Treatment

Column: characteristics[treatment]

Ontology: NCI Thesaurus (NCIT)

Value |NCIT ID |Description

chemotherapy |NCIT:C15632 |Chemical drug treatm
keywords: individual organism part NCIT:C15632 NCIT:C27971 MONDO breast cancer subtype Ann Arbor stage NCI SDRF TNM NCIT:C28078 IV IMPORTANT NCIT:C4870 ancestry category NCIT:C28076 HANCESTRO:0005 HANCESTRO:0009 MONDO:0005148 dose body mass index TNM staging tumor grade CHEBI:27899 weight treatment treatment status HANCESTRO smoking status NCIT:C71732 HIPAA NCIT:C65107 compound PR NCIT:C65106 menopausal status NCIT:C18206 exclamation NCIT:C65108 ER GDPR CHEBI:28748 NCIT:C27966 treatment response disease stage pre-existing condition sampling time point MONDO:0005044 ID NCIT:C15262 AJCC Dukes stage NCIT NCIT:C53554

chemotherapy |NCIT:C15632 |Chemical drug treatm

title: Data File Metadata Guidelines
content:
Data File Metadata Guidelines

Introduction

This document provides detailed guidelines for data file metadata fields that require specific formatting or have complex standardization requirements. For basic field descriptions, see the main SDRF-Proteomics specification.

Version 1.0.0 - 2025-01

CV Term Format

For data file metadata columns that reference ontology terms, use the structured CV term format:

NT={term name};AC={accession}

Examples:

- Dissociation method: NT=HCD;AC=PRIDE:0000590
- Fractionation method: NT=High-pH reversed-phase chromatography;AC=PRIDE:0000564
- Instrument: NT=Q Exactive HF;AC=MS:1002523
- Label: NT=TMT126;AC=PRIDE:0000285

Why use the structured format?

1. Automated annotation: Many data file properties (instrument, acquisition method, dissociation method) can be automatically determined by software from raw files.
2. Validation: Accession numbers enable automated validation against ontologies.
3. Interoperability: Structured terms are unambiguous across different tools and databases.

 Unlike sample metadata (characteristics) which are typically annotated manually using simple term names, data file metadata benefits from the structured CV term format because these values are often extracted programmatically from instrument files.

Label

Column: comment[label]

Ontology: PRIDE Ontology - Label

Describes the isotopic label applied to each sample.

Label-free: Use label free sample.

TMT labels: TMT126, TMT127N, TMT127C, TMT128N, TMT128C, TMT129N, TMT129C, TMT130N, TMT130C, TMT131N, TMT131C, TMT132N, TMT132C, TMT133N, TMT133C, TMT134N, TMT134C, TMT135N

iTRAQ labels: iTRAQ113, iTRAQ114, iTRAQ115, iTRAQ116, iTRAQ117, iTRAQ118, iTRAQ119, iTRAQ121

SILAC labels: SILAC light, SILAC medium, SILAC heavy

MS2 Mass Analyzer

Column: comment[MS2 mass analyzer]

Specifies the analyzer used for MS2 scans. Important for hybrid instruments.

Values: orbitrap, ion trap, quadrupole, TOF.

DIA Scan Window

Column: comment[MS1 scan range]

Format: {
keywords: MS:1003246 cleavage agent details TIP MS:1000422 SDRF dissociation method PRIDE:0000564 scan window upper limit REQUIRED UVPD MS:1000598 PP RECOMMENDED label precursor mass tolerance collision energy AC UNIMOD fractionation method HF scan window lower limit MS:1001251 PRIDE:0000561 SH SILAC CV DTT CAA PRIDE:0000590 reduction reagent fragment mass tolerance SDS PRIDE NCE IAM PSI MS:1002631 MOD UNIMOD:35 CID HCD MS:1001309 MS ETD TA exclamation MS1 scan range TMT SCX MS:1000133 MS:1002523 IAA fraction identifier PRIDE:0000553 modification parameters NT PRIDE:0000285 MT UNIMOD:4 MS2 mass analyzer PRIDE:0000551 TCEP NOTE TOF PAGE README depletion DIA alkylation reagent

title: Data File Metadata Guidelines
content:
Data File Metadata Guidelines

Introduction

This document provides detailed guidelines for data file metadata fields that require specific formatting or have complex standardization requirements. For basic field descriptions, see the main SDRF-Proteomics specification.

Version 1.0.0 - 2025-01

CV Term Format

For data file metadata columns that reference ontology terms, use the structured CV term format:

NT={term name};AC={accession}

Examples:

- Dissociation method: NT=HCD;AC=PRIDE:0000590
- Fractionation method: NT=High-pH reversed-phase chromatography;AC=PRIDE:0000564
- Instrument: NT=Q Exactive HF;AC=MS:1002523
- Label: NT=TMT126;AC=PRIDE:0000285

Why use the structured format?

1. Automated annotation: Many data file properties (instrument, acquisition method, dissociation method) can be automatically determined by software from raw files.
2. Validation: Accession numbers enable automated validation against ontologies.
3. Interoperability: Structured terms are unambiguous across different tools and databases.

 Unlike sample metadata (characteristics) which are typically annotated manually using simple term names, data file metadata benefits from the structured CV term format because these values are often extracted programmatically from instrument files.

Label

Column: comment[label]

Ontology: PRIDE Ontology - Label

Describes the isotopic label applied to each sample.

Label-free: Use label free sample.

TMT labels: TMT126, TMT127N, TMT127C, TMT128N, TMT128C, TMT129N, TMT129C, TMT130N, TMT130C, TMT131N, TMT131C, TMT132N, TMT132C, TMT133N, TMT133C, TMT134N, TMT134C, TMT135N

iTRAQ labels: iTRAQ113, iTRAQ114, iTRAQ115, iTRAQ116, iTRAQ117, iTRAQ118, iTRAQ119, iTRAQ121

SILAC labels: SILAC light, SILAC medium, SILAC heavy

MS2 Mass Analyzer

Column: comment[MS2 mass analyzer]

Specifies the analyzer used for MS2 scans. Important for hybrid instruments.

Values: orbitrap, ion trap, quadrupole, TOF.

DIA Scan Window

Column: comment[MS1 scan range]

Format: {
keywords: MS:1003246 cleavage agent details MS:1000422 SDRF dissociation method PRIDE:0000564 scan window upper limit REQUIRED UVPD MS:1000598 PP RECOMMENDED label precursor mass tolerance collision energy AC UNIMOD fractionation method HF scan window lower limit MS:1001251 PRIDE:0000561 SH SILAC CV DTT CAA PRIDE:0000590 reduction reagent fragment mass tolerance SDS PRIDE NCE IAM PSI MS:1002631 MOD UNIMOD:35 CID HCD MS:1001309 MS ETD TA MS1 scan range TMT SCX MS:1000133 MS:1002523 IAA fraction identifier PRIDE:0000553 modification parameters NT PRIDE:0000285 MT UNIMOD:4 MS2 mass analyzer PRIDE:0000551 TCEP TOF PAGE depletion DIA alkylation reagent
